section.title: Executive summary
section.para: VFPlot is quite standard in its configuration, the usual
use --prefix option to ./configure if you want to install elsewhere than /usr/local.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: Although not required for compilation, the NetCDF library is needed if VFPlot is to read GMT grd files. At present this is the main way to get data into VFPlot.
If you want support for Gerris flow solver use the --enable-gerris option in configuration. You will need to have a recent version of the Gerris software.

section.title: Portability
section.para: VFplot should compile on any modern POSIX operating system with a C99 compiler. It is developed on Linux on x86, amd64 and sparc architectures with the GNU C compiler and the Intel C++ compiler.
